How to Use the Single-cell Schemas Website

The Single-cell Schema website supports two main research areas:

  • Single-Cell Ribonucleic Acid Sequencing (Single-cell RNA Sequencing)
  • Spatial Transcriptomics with a focus on Sequencing and Fluorescence In Situ Hybridisation (FISH)

Follow these steps to navigate the site effectively:

  1. Select a standard and a technology from the dropdown menus on the left of the web page.
  2. If data is available for your selection, the contents in the centre of the web page will automatically update to reflect the matching data.
  3. If no data is available, a modal will notify you.
  4. You can download a blank manifest related to your selection if data is available for it.

Navigate through the sections below to understand how the website integrates different combinations of standards and technologies.
